text: [Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
hello I'm gilian A Cloud support
engineer here at the AWS office in Cape
Town today I'm going to show you how to
authorize your AWS Lambda function when
subscribing to an Amazon simple
notification service topic let's get
started after logging into the AWS
Management console navigate to the AWS
identity and access Management console
select users
at the user search bar enter your
username and then select it
at the permissions tab select add inline
policy
for choose service enter Lambda and then
select it
at the filter search box enter add
permission and then check the box
choose specify function resource RN for
the add permission action
with specific options selected choose
add Arn
here enter the region and the function
name and then choose add
here enter the region and the function
name and then choose add
please note that this permission is
necessary when subscribing through the
CLI
then select add additional permissions
choose service enter SNS and then select
it
at the filter search box enter subscribe
and then check the box
choose specify topic resource error in
for the Subscribe action
with specific options selected choose
add air in
here you enter the region and the topic
name then click add
choose review policy
enter a name for the policy such as
Lambda add permission SNS subscribe and
then choose create policy
now let's navigate to the SNS console
choose topics
at the search bar enter the name of your
topic and select it
copy the topic Arn and save it to your
clipboard or annotate in a text editor
now choose the edit button on the top
right hand corner
scroll down and expand the access policy
section
add a statement allowing the Lambda
account to perform SNS subscribe as
mandatory and SNS list subscription by
topic optionally
enter the Sid such as Lambda axis
effect to allow
Principle as AWS
and the account ID where the Lambda
resides
action as SNS subscribe and Resource as
the SNS topic Arn copied previously
after the statement is added to the
Topic's access policy select save
changes
Now navigate to the Lambda console
at the filter search box enter the name
of your function and then select it
select the configuration tab
on the left hand menu select permissions
scroll down until the resource-based
policy section and select add
permissions
choose the AWS service checkbox
at the service drop down select SNS
for statement ID enter a unique ID such
as SNS invoke permission
for principle make sure that it's set to
sns.amazonaws.com
in the source Arn paste in the SNS topic
Arn
at the action drop down list select
Lambda and Vogue function and then
choose save
you can also perform this action using
the Lambda add permission CLI command in
the article
you can perform this action using the
Lambda add permission CLI command which
you can find in the knowledge Center
article note that if this is a cross
account scenario then it is required to
perform the subscription action from the
account where the Lambda function is
located for the subscription navigate to
the SNS console
choose subscriptions
select create subscription
paste the topic Arn
for protocol choose Lambda from the drop
down list
at the endpoint search bar enter the
Lambda function name and then select it
select create subscription
you can also perform this action using
the SNS subscribe CLI command which you
can find in the knowledge Center article
and now you know how to authorize your
Lambda function when subscribing it to
an SNS topic
thanks for watching and happy cloud
computing from all of us here at AWS
[Applause]
[Music]
[Music]
